newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Ericsson takes action against counterfeits.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson takes action against counterfeits.

text.p: Swedish telecoms group Ericsson said on Monday it had taken action against more than 30 companies illegally using its logo or infringing on its registered design rights.
The company said in a statement it had issued 'cease and desist' letters to more than 30 manufacturers.
"Currently, a substantial number of manufacturers have complied with the company's request to immediately remove those items," the company said in a statement.
"For companies that do not comply, Ericsson is planning to take further action, such as civil claims as well as criminal prosecution."
The actions are part of Ericsson's enhanced efforts to crack down on companies that infringe upon its trademark rights and design rights, the company said.
"Such counterfeit products often do no meet the manufacturer's quality and safety standards, making them susceptible to malfunctions," the company said.
"In such cases, Ericsson cannot accept warranty claims."
